intro: Soranthe dregei, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, evergreen leaves and small, white flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, orange aril. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
